name: If-ElseIf-Else block
prompt:
Add a public function called Classify to Calculator.calr that classifies a number as negative, zero, or positive. It takes i32 parameter x and returns i32 (-1 for negative, 0 for zero, 1 for positive).

Use this exact Calor if-elseif-else syntax:
§F{f003:Classify:pub}
  §I{i32:x}
  §O{i32}
  §IF{if001} (< x 0)
    §R (- 0 1)
  §EI (== x 0)
    §R 0
  §EL
    §R 1
  §/I{if001}
§/F{f003}

The §IF{id}/§EI/§EL/§/I{id} syntax creates conditional blocks where:
- §IF{id} starts the if branch with an identifier
- §EI (condition) is else-if (can have multiple) - no identifier needed
- §EL is else - no identifier needed
- §/I{id} closes the block with matching identifier
